result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Adam Czap

defendant.name: Czap, Joshua Adam
defendant.address: 1206 South First Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt: Mailed to employer 11-1-2022. so
Jury status hearing on November 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:29 AM Cases 22CF92, 22CF113, 22CF125, & 22CF144 called together - appearances stated
 Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua Adam Czap in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Joshua Adam Czap. 

Judge states these cases are all on for adj. initial appearances - and all ready to be set for Prelim. Hearing
Atty. Frank states def. waives reading of complaint - prepared to waive preliminary hearings in all three (3) cases, filed waiver of prelim. forms yesterday in 3 cases
states he is not appointed on 22CF144 

Discussion re: Ct. Appointment in 22CF144 - Court states she is aware of defendant's income. Inquires how much additional he could pay on new case 
Court orders def. to pay $100/00 mo com. 1/1/23 on the 3 cases that previously had a $50/mo order (22CF92, 22CF113 & 22CF125)
Court finds def. to be partially indigent, grants petition for appt. of counsel, will appoint Atty Frank in case 22CF144 - Def. to pay $50./mo com. 1/1/23

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire forms with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probably cause and  binds def. over for further proceedings
Atty. Frank states they are prepared to go to arraignment today

State files the Information on all four (4) cases at this time

Atty Frank states if they track with the criminal complaints the def. waives formal reading - Def. stands mute as to each count in each of the four cases
Clerk directed to enter a NOT GUILTY plea to each count in each of the four (4) cases
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Adam Czap
Current: 1206 South First Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: Prairie Motel 1616 South Marquette Road, #52, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821
Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:31 PM Defendant Joshua Adam Czap in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Joshua Adam Czap.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Frank is heard on being appointed to the fourth case.  Adjourned all cases so all four cases can track together and Attorney Frank can be appointed to 22cf144.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - Court appoints Atty Mark Frank
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:29 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua Adam Czap in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney.  Court reviews the affidavit of indigency. Court will grant the defendants petition of indigency.  Court will appoint an attorney. Court will check in with Attorney Frank to see if he can take this case. Court will order wage assignment of $50.00 per paycheck.
Status hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:15 AM Case called - appearances stated. Cases 22CF92, 22CF113 AND 22CF125 CALLED TOGETHER

Defendant Joshua Adam Czap in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF92 - INITIAL APPEARANCE
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Def. states understanding

22CF113 - INITIAL APPEARANCE
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Def. states understanding

22CF125 - INITIAL APPEARANCE
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Def. states understanding

Court questions def. re: efforts to hire an attorney - response by def.  - States Public Defender will not re-evaluate for another 90 days, spoke with Atty. Frank to represent on all cases, cannot afford retainer.

Atty Steiner takes no position

Court will continue for couple weeks for def. to resolve employment issues, if he wishes to have court appointed attorney, def. must pick up paperwork and file before next hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:16 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua Adam Czap not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard on non appearance.  State requests a warrant.  Defendant to be held for further bond hearing.
Per SPD Office, Mr. Czap is not eligible for a public defender at this time.

1:46 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua Adam Czap in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Joshua Adam Czap. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding. Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
pd. $200 at CCSO
Hearing on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:01 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua A Czap appeared by video, in custody. Atty. Luke Steiner, D.A. appears via vide.  Atty. Mark Frank appears in person on behalf of Def.
     D.A. requests $500 cash bond, not possess/consume any controlled substance, testing per LE.  D.A. comments on concerns.
     Atty. Frank comments; requests a treatment court sanction and continue in treatment court; requests a signature bond.
     Def. with no comment.
     Court comments. Court orders cash bond of $200; Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. To submit to testing by L.E. as requested; if positive, to submit to a blood draw.
     Court explains right to an attorney and that Atty. Frank has not been assigned to this case.
     Court concludes at 1:11 p.m.  Atty. may appear via ZOOM for the initial appearance; Def. to be in person.
Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant.  To submit to testing by Law Enforcement as requested, if positive, to submit to a blood draw.
